CCAPI.BrokerInterface
Class CCAPITrustManager

java.lang.Object
  CCAPI.BrokerInterface.CCAPITrustManager
All Implemented Interfaces:
javax.net.ssl.TrustManager, javax.net.ssl.X509TrustManager
public class CCAPITrustManager
extends java.lang.Object
implements javax.net.ssl.X509TrustManager

This is the CCAPITrustManager. The TrustManager is called to check a server certificate. For those who don't know the procedure: The client connects over SSL, the server sends a certificate, the client checks this cert to verifiy that the server is the server it want's to connect to, the client reacts appropriate. The current implementation is highly unsecure - it accepts every certificate - but server hijacking is really really rare in the current internet - trust a hacker.

Author:
us
